Label: AL rdfs:label@en
Definition: AL IAO:0000115@en

Label: biological ecosystem management process
Definition: An active ecosystem management process in which a human adds or removes biological material from an area to realize some ecological management goal.

Label: planting process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human plants flora (defined as at least having sprouted true leaves) in the soil of a given area.

Label: plug planting process
Definition: A planting process in which a human plants flora grown in a plug tray.

Label: shrub planting process
Definition: A planting process in which a human plants shrubs.

Label: tree planting process
Definition: A planting process in which a human plants trees.

Label: seedling planting process
Definition: A planting process in which a human plants trees that have been grown in plug trays.

Label: caliper tree planting process
Definition: A planting process in which a human plants trees that have grown to a diameter >= 5 cm.

Label: live staking process
Definition: A planting process in which a human inserts cut branches of a flora into soil such that that flora will take root and grow.

Label: nurse plant process
Definition: A planting process in which a human plants flora with the goal of assisting the growth of other flora.

Label: seeding process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human sows seeds in a particular area.

Label: tree seeding process
Definition: A seeding process in which a human sows tree seeds.

Label: line seeding process
Definition: A seeding process in which a human sows seeds in lines along a landscape.

Label: drill seeding process
Definition: A seeding process in which a human uses a drill seeder to sow seeds.

Label: broadcast seeding process
Definition: A seeding process in which a human sows seeds by scattering them through the air.

Label: hand broadcast seeding process
Definition: A seeding process in which a human scatters seeds by hand.

Label: hydroseeding process
Definition: A seeding process in which a human applies seed in a slurry of nutrients and fixatives.

Label: seed treatment process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human applies a treatment to seed prior to sowing it.

Label: seed scarification process
Definition: A seed treatment process in which a human damages the coating of the seed, usually using sandpaper, to enhance germination.

Label: heat seed treatment process
Definition: A seed treatment process in which a human applies heat to some seed in order to enhance germination.

Label: chill seed treatment process
Definition: A seed treatment process in which a human applies cold to some seed in order to enhance germination, such as in cold stratification.

Label: soak seed treatment process
Definition: A seed treatment process in which a human soaks seeds in order to enhance germination.

Label: light seed treatment process
Definition: A seed treatment process in which light is applied to seeds in order to enhance germination.

Label: chemical seed treatment process
Definition: A seed treatment process in which some chemical is applied to some seed in order to enhance germination.

Label: biological fauna control process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human uses biological means to reduce or increase a population of fauna.

Label: captive breeding and release process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human facilitates the breeding of fauna, rears the young for a period of time and releases them in some environment.

Label: egg relocation and release process
Definition: A captive breeding and release process in which a human collects eggs and relocates them to a safe environment, whereupon they are allowed to hatch.

Label: egg incubation and release process
Definition: An egg relocation and release process in which a human collects eggs and relocates them into an incubator, whereupon they are allowed to hatch and released into some environment.

Label: young capture, rearing and release
Definition: A captive breeding and release process in which a human captures young fauna, rears them into adulthood and releases them into some environment.

Label: supplemental water process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human provides supplemental water to flora or fauna.

Label: supplemental feeding process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human provides supplemental food to fauna.

Label: plant material transfer process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human transfers plant material from some area to another.

Label: moss layer transfer process
Definition: A plant material transfer process in which a human restores the hydroperiod of a peatland by blocking drainage ditches or other means and subsequently moves material from the moss layer (top 10 cm) of another peatland onto the one being restored.

Label: soil transfer process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human transfers soil from one area to another.

Label: fauna sterilization process
Definition: A biological fauna control process in which a human renders some fauna sterile in order to reduce their population.

Label: egg destruction process
Definition: A biological fauna control process in which a human destroys the eggs of some fauna (e.g. oiling goose eggs).

Label: nest establishment deterrence process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human implements measures to deter fauna from establishing nest sites in a given area.

Label: seabed amendment process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human adds material to a seabed to facilitate nesting.

Label: soil amendment process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human adds some material to soil.

Label: mulch addition process
Definition: A soil amendment process in which a human adds mulch (i.e. woody debris).

Label: peat addition process
Definition: A soil amendment process in which a human adds peat.

Label: topsoil addition process
Definition: A soil amendment process in which a human adds topsoil.

Label: compost addition process
Definition: A soil amendment process in which a human adds some composted organic material.

Label: manure addition process
Definition: A soil amendment process in which a human adds some manure.

Label: artificial reef creation process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human creates an artificial reef out of materials with the goal of attracting coral.

Label: intentional grazing
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human introduces grazing animals to an area with the goal of recreating a disturbance regime.

Label: mycorrhizae addition process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human adds mycorrhizae spores to some environment.

Label: peatland rewetting process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human alters the hydroperiod of a peatland such that more water is available.

Label: fauna rescue, rehabilitation and release process
Definition: A biological fauna control process in which a human captures injured fauna from some environment, rehabilitates and releases them.

Label: fauna reintroduction process
Definition: A biological fauna control process in which a human reintroduces fauna into some environment where the fauna once existed.

Label: fauna medical care process
Definition: A biological fauna control process in which a human provides medical care to some fauna.

Label: translocation process
Definition: A biological ecosystem management process in which a human translocates some flora or fauna from one area to another.

Label: fauna translocation process
Definition: A translocation process in which a human translocates some fauna from one area to another.

Label: coral translocation process
Definition: A translocation process in which a human translocates coral from one area to another.

Label: chemical ecosystem management process
Definition: An active ecosystem management process in which a human applys or releases a chemical substance to realize some ecological management goal.

Label: chemical application process
Definition: A chemical ecosystem management process in which a human applies some chemical to an ecosystem.

Label: fertilizer application process
Definition: A chemical application process in which a human applies chemical fertilizer to a given area with the goal of increasing the available carbon, nitrogen or phosphorous.

Label: lime application process
Definition: A chemical application process in which a human adds lime to soil or water in order to reduce the pH.

Label: herbicide application process
Definition: A chemical application process in which a human applies herbicide to plants or soil in a given area.

Label: glyphosate application process
Definition: A herbicide application process in which a human applies the herbicide glyphosate to plants in some area.

Label: insecticide application process
Definition: A chemical application process in which a human introduces an insecticide to some area with the goal of managing an insect population.

Label: ecosystem-oriented social process
Definition: An environmental system process in which a human employs social means to realize some ecosystem management goal.

Label: legislation process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which a humans collectively implement legislation with pro-environmental goals.

Label: legal protection process
Definition: A legislation process in which the legislation explicitly protects something from degradation.

Label: legal habitat protection process
Definition: A legal protection process in which the legal protection applies to a specific habitat.

Label: legal landscape protection process
Definition: A legal protection process in which the legal protection applies to a specific landscape.

Label: legal species protection process
Definition: A legal protection process in which the legal protection applies to some taxa.

Label: legal marine area protection process
Definition: A legal protection process in which the legal protection applies to some marine area.

Label: private land protection process
Definition: A legal protection process in which the legal protection applies to some privately held land.

Label: conservation easement process
Definition: A private land protection process in which a landowner agrees to conserve a portion of their land in perpetuity.

Label: area policy process
Definition: A legislation process in which some legislation applies to some area.

Label: local bylaw process
Definition: An area policy process in which some pro-conservation bylaw is established by a local authority.

Label: provincial or state legislation process
Definition: A legislation process in which some group passes pro-conservation legislation at the state or province level.

Label: national legislation process
Definition: A legislation process in which some group passes pro-conservation legislation at the national level.

Label: international agreement process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which a humans collectively agree to measures that protect, conserve and restore biodiversity.

Label: active enforcement process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which a human actively enforces the pro-conservation legislation or policies governing a specific area.

Label: human-wildlife conflict reduction process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which a human implements measures to reduce conflict between fauna and humans.

Label: human-assisted road crossing process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which a human assists a species in crossing a road.

Label: awareness-raising process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which a human undertakes a process in order to make others more aware of threats to biodiversity.

Label: social media campaign process
Definition: An awareness-raising process in which a human uses social media to spread messages about threats to biodiversity.

Label: community event creation process
Definition: An awareness-raising process in which a human hosts an event for the community in a given area.

Label: education process
Definition: An awareness-raising process in which a human endeavours to improve the knowledge of others vis-a-vis restoration or conservation of biodiversity.

Label: citizen science process
Definition: An awareness-raising process in which a humans gather measurements of some ecosystem elements.

Label: community engagement process
Definition: An awareness-raising process in which a humans are gathered in a given area and engaged in the restoration and conservation of biodiversity.

Label: pro-environmental behaviour change process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which a human endeavours to alter the behaviour of others vis-a-vis the degradation of ecosystems.

Label: signage installation process
Definition: A pro-environmental behaviour change process in which signage is installed to encourage or deter activities in an area.

Label: individual outreach process
Definition: A pro-environmental behaviour change process in which a human reaches out to people directly to encourage or deter activities in an area.

Label: landowner outreach process
Definition: A pro-environmental behaviour change process in which a human reaches out to a landowner to encourage or deter activities in an area.

Label: sensitive features marking process
Definition: A pro-environmental behaviour change process in which a human marks environmentally sensitive features to deter degradation or interference.

Label: fundraising process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which a human raises funds to support the restoration and conservation of a specific area.

Label: financial incentive process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which financial incentives are offered to a humans in order to take pro-environmental measures.

Label: environmental usage regulation process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which some authority regulates the usage of environments.

Label: regulate grazing
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority regulates grazing in a given area.

Label: prohibit grazing
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority prohibits grazing in a given area.

Label: regulate fishing
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority regulates fishing in a given area.

Label: prohibit fishing
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority prohibits fishing in a given area.

Label: regulate chemical usage
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority regulates chemical usage in a given area.

Label: prohibit chemical usage
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority prohibits chemical usage in a given area.

Label: regulate hunting
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority regulates hunting in a given area.

Label: prohibit hunting
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority prohibits hunting in a given area.

Label: regulate recreational activities
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority regulates recreational activities in a given area.

Label: prohibit recreational activities
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority prohibits recreational activities in a given area.

Label: limit public access
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority limits public access to a given area.

Label: prohibit public access
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority prohibits public access to a given area.

Label: regulate dredging
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority regulates dredging in a given area.

Label: prohibit dredging
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority prohibits dredging in a given area.

Label: regulate aquaculture
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority regulates aquaculture in a given area.

Label: prohibit aquaculture
Definition: An environmental usage regulation process in which some authority prohibits aquaculture in a given area.

Label: cultural ecosystem management process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which a humans undertake shared practices passed down through generations to manage the ecosystem in which they live.

Label: cultural ecosystem usage process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which a humans harvest resources from the environment for shared practices that are passed down through generations.

Label: plan specification change process
Definition: A ecosystem-oriented social process in which a human alters the way in which some planned process is undertaken.

Label: alter mowing timing
Definition: A change to the mowing regime in which a human alters the timing of regular mowing with the goal of protecting specific taxa.

Label: alter mowing regime
Definition: A plan specification change process in which a human alters the mowing regime (i.e. frequency, height, timing)

Label: alter mowing height
Definition: A change to the mowing regime in which a human alters the height of a mower with the goal of protecting specific taxa.

Label: alter tilling regime
Definition: A change to the tilling regime in which a human alters the frequency, timing or severity of a regular tilling process.

Label: alter chemical regime
Definition: A change to the chemical regime in which a human alters the frequency, timing or severity of a regular chemical application process.

Label: alter insecticide regime
Definition: A change to the insecticide regime in which a human alters the frequency, timing or severity of a regular insecticide application process.

Label: alter fertilizer regime
Definition: A change to the fertilizer regime in which a human alters the frequency, timing or severity of a regular fertilizer application process.

Label: alter lighting regime
Definition: A change to the lighting regime in which a human alters the frequency, timing or intensity of lighting.

Label: alter grazing regime
Definition: A change to the grazing regime in which a human alters the frequency, timing or intensity of grazing.

Label: alter dam regime
Definition: A change to the dam regime in which a human alters the frequency, timing or intensity of water released by a dam.

Label: alter herbicide regime
Definition: A change to the herbicide regime in which a human alters the frequency, timing or severity of a regular herbicide application process.

Label: cease herbicide usage
Definition: A change to the herbicide regime in which a human ceases some herbicide application process.

Label: mechanical ecosystem management process
Definition: An active ecosystem management process during which a human employs machines or tools to directly impact an ecosystem and realize some ecosystem management goal.

Label: mechanical vegetation removal process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process during which vegetation is removed.

Label: root wrench removal process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process in which a human employs a tool comprising a lever and gripping portion (root wrench).

Label: cut and cover removal process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process during which plants at ground level are cut and residual stumps are covered with a sun-blocking material (e.g. silage tarp).

Label: cutting removal process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process in which a human cuts and removes plant material.

Label: spading removal process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process in which a human severs subsoil roots using a spade and pries the plant out of the ground.

Label: canopy thinning process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process in which a human removes trees from a given area with the goal of reducing overall canopy cover thereby increasing light availability for understorey plants.

Label: leaf litter removal process
Definition: A mechanical vegetation removal process in which a human removes leaf litter from the ground thereby increasing the light availability for soil.

Label: mechanical fauna control process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human controls fauna populations.

Label: mammal trapping process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which a human uses traps to control fauna.

Label: predator control process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which a human targets predators for removal from the ecosystem.

Label: fencing process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which a human installs fencing to restrict either immigration or emmigration of fauna from a particular area.

Label: mechanical species deterrent process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which a human installs an electronic device to deter species from a particular area.

Label: mechanical hydrological alteration process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process during which a human deliberately alters the hydrologic cycle in an area.

Label: dam construction process
Definition: A mechanical hydrological alteration process in which a human constructs some dam to restore a meander sequence to a river or stream.

Label: dam removal process
Definition: A mechanical hydrological alteration process in which a human removes some dam with the goal of altering the hydroperiod of surrounding lands and reconnecting rivers.

Label: tile drain crushing process
Definition: A mechanical hydrological alteration process in which a human uncovers and collapses subterranean tile drains in situ to reduce drainage on the landscape and restore wetland hydroperiod.
editors note: This technique is actively practiced by the Nature Conservancy of Canada, but has not been documented in the literature yet.

Label: tile drain removal process
Definition: A mechanical hydrological alteration process in which a human uncovers and removes subterranean tile drains to reduce drainage on the landscape and restore wetland hydroperiod.

Label: nest site creation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human creates sites for fauna to breed, feed and shelter.

Label: perch creation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human creates places for birds to perch.

Label: buffer strip creation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human cultivates strips of flora between landscape features using earthworks and planting processes.

Label: riparian buffer strip creation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human cultivates strips of flora in the riparian areas of rivers.

Label: buffer strip retention process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human leaves strips of flora untouched when clearing the land for other purposes.

Label: earthworks process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process during which the topology of some area is deliberately changed at least at the micro scale (e.g. 1m2).
editors note: Difficult to suggest a firm border for scale. I doubt digging out a small hole would be called "earthworks" but settled on at least 1 m2 of earth moved. See Landscape Microscale Size and its associated scale properties for more nuance: ENVO:03620005; ENVO:03620006; ENVO:03620007; ENVO:03620008

Label: berm creation process
Definition: An earthworks process in which earthen barriers (berms) are constructed with the goal of obstructing or slowing floodwaters.

Label: pond creation process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human creates a pond.

Label: pond reprofiling process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human reshapes the banks or basin of a pond.

Label: soil decompaction process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human alleviates the compaction of soil.

Label: tilling process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human breaks up the soil, and sometimes adds organic matter.

Label: ploughing process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human deeply breaks up and overturns soil and vegetation.

Label: grading process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human creates a specific slope.

Label: slope stabilization process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human installs inorganic material, usually a mesh, to stabilize a slope.

Label: shoreline reinforcement process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human installs inorganic material, usually in a mesh, to stabilize a slope on the bank of a body of water.

Label: pit and mound excavation process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human digs pits and creates mounds to reproduce a natural disturbance regime.

Label: channel realignment process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human realigns the channel of a stream by digging out replacement pathways and filling existing ones.

Label: natural channel realignment process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human realigns the channel of a stream by digging out replacement pathways and filling existing ones with the goal of recreating a natural pool-riffle-pool meander sequence.

Label: dredging process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human removes the sediment layer of a water body.

Label: fauna passage creation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human creates a crossing (bridge or underpass) to help fauna pass through a barrier such as a road, fence or property.

Label: topsoil removal process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human removes the topsoil layer.

Label: erosion control process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human installs some material to reduce erosion.

Label: erosion blanket process
Definition: An erosion control process in which a human installs a textile.

Label: erosion fencing process
Definition: An erosion control process in which a human installs a fence with a geotextile to restrict sediment transport.

Label: wattle fencing process
Definition: An erosion control process in which a human interleaves live materials to make short fencing along a slope.

Label: irrigation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human installs semi-permanent lines to supply a controlled amount of water to plants.

Label: deterrence-focused predator control process
Definition: A predator control process in which a human installs a mechanical device designed to deter predators from a given area.

Label: fauna exclusion process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which a human excludes fauna from a specific area.

Label: mechanical fauna deterrent process
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which a human deters fauna from a specific area.

Label: fauna capture for conservation
Definition: A mechanical fauna control process in which a human captures fauna for the purposes of protecting existing organisms from some threat.

Label: fish bypass installation process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human installs some means of bypassing hazards (e.g. dams) for fish.

Label: fish ladder installation process
Definition: A fish bypass installation process in which a human installs a chute consisting of a series of stepped pools to allow fish to move past a dam.

Label: ditch plugging process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human fills in a drainage ditch to restore the hydroperiod to a given area.

Label: sediment addition process
Definition: An earthworks process in which a human adds sediment to a water body in order to modify the substrate composition.

Label: new plant protection process
Definition: A mechanical ecosystem management process in which a human installs a barrier to protect newly planted flora from herbivory.

Label: fishing with equipment modified for conservation
Definition: A planned environmental usage process in which fishing equipment is modified for conservation (e.g. bycatch deterrent devices are installed)

Label: fishing with net modified for conservation
Parent: fishing with equipment modified for conservation
Definition: A fishing process in which a human uses a net that has been modified to reduce bycatch or accomplish some other conservation-oriented goal.

Label: fishing with hook modified for conservation
Parent: fishing with equipment modified for conservation
Definition: A fishing process in which a human uses a hook that has been modified for conservation.

Label: fishing with added acoustic devices for conservation
Parent: fishing with equipment modified for conservation
Definition: A fishing process in which a human adds acoustic devices to fishing gear to deter bycatch.

Label: fishing with modified traps
Parent: fishing with equipment modified for conservation
Definition: A fishing process in which a human uses traps modified to deter bycatch.

Label: fishing with modified line-setting procedure
Parent: fishing with equipment modified for conservation
Definition: A fishing process in which a human attaches bait to lines in a way that deters seabird scavenging (i.e. underwater)

Label: aquaculture process modified for conservation
Definition: A planned environmental usage process in which a human engages in aquaculture with modifications for conservation (e.g. disease control measures)

Label: underwater turbine modified for conservation
Definition: A planned environmental usage process in which a human installs an underwater turbine modified for conservation.

Label: farming process modified for conservation
Definition: A planned environmental usage process in which a human engages in farming with modifications for the conservation of biodiversity.

Label: farming with intercropping
Definition: A farming process modified for conservation in which a human grows two or more crop varities in close proximity to one another.

Label: agroforestry process
Definition: A farming process modified for conservation in which a human integrates trees and crops or pasture.

Label: alley cropping farming process
Definition: An agroforestry process in which crops are grown in between rows of trees and shrubs.

Label: no-till farming
Definition: A farming process modified for conservation in which a human does not disturb the soil in between crop plantings.

Label: organic farming regime
Definition: A farming process modified for conservation in which a human avoids synthetic or chemical inputs in the farming process. The definition of organic is often the subject of government regulation.

Label: crop rotation
Definition: A farming process modified for conservation in which the crop type is rotated year over year.

Label: set aside farmland for conservation
Definition: A farming process modified for conservation in which a human agrees not to farm some portion of a landscape.

Label: forestry process modified for conservation
Definition: A planned environmental usage process in which a human harvests trees in a manner that attempts to ameliorate the impact on the landscape.

Label: coppice process
Definition: A forestry process in which a human cuts trees down to the stump, allowing the trees to regenerate from the stump.

Label: selective harvesting process
Definition: A forestry process in which a human harvests trees according to their age with the goal of preserving some overall age for a forest stand.

Label: woody debris removal process
Definition: A forestry process in which a human removes coarse woody debris after harvesting trees, thereby reducing the risk and intensity of forest fire.

Label: leave woody debris
Definition: A forestry process in which a human leaves coarse woody debris after harvesting, thereby increasing available resources.

Label: shelterwood cutting process
Definition: A forestry process in which a human primarily harvests large trees in order to increase light availability for seedling species.

Label: regulate wind turbine speed
Definition: A planned environmental usage process in which a human modifies the level of wind speed required to spin turbines, thereby preventing avifauna fatalities.
